website_summaries.verdict: Easily the most comprehensive option that tests for genetics and disease detection.
pros: Features a database of 175 breeds including wolf, coyote, and village dog mix
Specific enough to identify paternal and maternal ancestry
Partners with Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine to create certified results
cons: It's pricier than many other choices

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: it seems they gave me every dog EXCEPT ridgeback for my ridgeback mix. they could detect golden retriever but not even a hint of rhodesian ridgeback? does that seriously make sense? don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Very cool. My dog is a rescue and I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. My dog is a rescue and I was told he was a border collie mix. His personality lead me to do a test because he just didn’t have the personality a border collie. Come to find out he’s a Shih Tzu pitbull mix which makes way more sense. I included picture because everyone has a hard time picturing a Shih Tzu pit mix.
customer_reviews.author: dede123

customer_reviews.title: Good info followed by SPAM!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the DNA report however The report is followed by regular spam. If you use this service I suggest a temporary email address that you can delete after receiving the reports. No way to know for sure but I suspect, like most spammers, they sell your other information too.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Far from accurate
customer_reviews.text: I think Embark may have accidentally switched DNA samples because there is no this is accurate. My 6-month pup has a nonshedding long coat and is 15 pounds. People will think I am crazy if I tell them she is a Pitbull, Chihuahua, Rottweiler mix LOL
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L

customer_reviews.title: Something's Off Here
customer_reviews.text: According to the test results, our dog is a 54-pound dog with medium-sized ancestors. In reality, she's a tall, lean, 90-pound dog. Something's off. In the end, I feel pretty silly that I paid this much money just to log into a website and see their guess at my dog's breed.
customer_reviews.author: fireflycat

customer_reviews.title: Breed Results Not Even Close
customer_reviews.text: I strongly believe this is a scam! I sent in my dogs DNA to get health results because that was my major concern. I was aware of her parents - her Mother was a Rat Terrier and her father was a Dachshund, I've SEEN them, I have no doubt about her parentage but the test results said she was 70% chihuahua and 12% Australian Cattle Dog. While there is some possibility that those breeds may be somewhere in her DNA - there is NO way that is her breed type. Not even close. I'm going to run a DNA test through a different company to see what the results are. VERY DISAPPOINTED! I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CLesterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I've tried 3 dog dna tests.  This one is very good.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried 3. Embark and Wisdom Panel results were very similar. Embark - a little more specific. Excellent overall. Wisdom Panel - very similar, I'd rate it very good. Identibreed had zero overlap. It’s as if they looked at photos and guessed the breed because by her photo, that's what she looked like. When I asked Identibreed about the difference, they asked me to send the other results and there was no follow up. At all. Buy Embark for the most complete. Buy Wisdom Panel if you are budget constrained. Avoid Identibreed.
customer_reviews.author: Singmaster

customer_reviews.title: DOUBT RESULTS
customer_reviews.text: My dog has none of the traits mentioned in the seven dogs it claims my dog has. They even got his coloring wrong. Even his appearance. Vet even agrees. Sorry I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: lilydaisy

customer_reviews.title: Breeds do not coincide with the appearance of my dog
customer_reviews.text: We received back like 5 types of breeds (dalmatian, german Shepard, american boxer,etc.) , and none coincides to the way our dog looks and acts like, which is mainly a border collie, not even close!
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed. The test came back with my 20-pound dog having large percentages of Chow Chow, Siberian Husky and American Pitbull Terrier. As you can see, she is quite small. I feel like I wasted a lot of money here.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Earle

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money, Bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: This DNA test lied on my dog in 100%, My dog can't be like this at all, when I called customer support I asked for the Manager Casey Ehrlich and she was so bad to me, she even told me she will speak with me the next week and nothing, she just disappearing, I tried to call her again and nothing from hear, She promised that if I won't be satisfied with the result they will send me a new test, and of course they lied to you because it cost them money and they want to save money .... my recommended to you is save your money for something better to your dog like toys,food...etc
customer_reviews.author: Yoli Shimon

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure that I can believe the results that I got. I have a rescue that was abandoned in a rental because he was a blind puppy. He is a genetic mess. He is blind and kind of a mutant. I love him but he was horribly misbred. My results says he is 100% purebred and has 0 at risk medical issues. I really have a hard time believing that he is a perfect dog.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Now we know what Maddy is.....
customer_reviews.text: We get stopped all the time by people asking 'what kind of dog is that?'. And I wanted to know too. I didn't tell Embark anything except he is sweet and loves car rides which is every dog. The results are pretty good, half Saint Bernard, half lab/retriever. The lab we could easily see. We couldn't figure out the other half. He is a large 120 pound brown dog. It was also neat to see the family history...mom is mostly Saint Bernard and dad is a mix of everything else. 35% Saint Bernard, 20% Lab, 15% Great Pyrenees, 13% German Shepherd, 10% Chesapeake Bay Retriever, 7% Golden Retriever
customer_reviews.author: BullyWag, Inc

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Think This is Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed and I highly suspect this is a scam. My dog came back as primarily a German Shepherd, with smaller percentages of rottweiler, boxer, and collie. There is no way. He is a medium, short haired dog with absolutely none of the same characteristics of these dogs. Had he come up ANYTHING that he remotely resembled I would be willing to accept the results...but this is junk science. My vet warned me ahead of time that these DNA tests are inaccurate, but curiosity got the best of me. I should have listened.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hicka

customer_reviews.title: Pass & save your money: The WORST  experience and it 2x the price to equivalent products.
customer_reviews.text: Embark has the worst customer service and the product they offer is no better then other products at half the price. I had questions regarding my results. Instead of addressing my question they decided to belittle me with there “education”. Embark’s product offers no distinctive difference from other products in the market for 1/2 the price. I would suggest going with a less expensive product at half the price and better customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: Skyrocket

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Basically regurgitated what I entered in the questionnaire back to me. Provided no useful info.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.text: What a scam, waste of money, and waste of time. I want my money back. My results came back mostly as a Norwegian Elkhound and Pitbull when she looks NOTHING like either. She clearly has border collie and they only found 7%...we even sent in a picture. Pretty sure they pick random breeds and give you fake results. So mad I wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M.

customer_reviews.title: I think they got it wrong
customer_reviews.text: I cannot claim to know 100% what breed my rescue dog is, but I think they got it wrong. I have had breeders and other owners of a particular breed tell us all the time that our dog looks like that breed. We looked it up and he absolutely looks like one of them. He also exhibits many of the characteristics of that breed. After mailing in the sample, Embark repeatedly asked for a picture of our dog... but I wanted results without giving any hints. When the results came back, that suspected breed was nowhere in the results. And some of the breeds in the results seemed absolutely wrong (English Bulldog? I don't think so.)
customer_reviews.author: james L Paull Jr

customer_reviews.title: Missed Dog type completely
customer_reviews.text: They said this dog was a pit bull...is 99 % border collie! Had no border collie in her. Asked for refund. Ask for new test if they were so sure. They just sent back pages of bull saying they could never make a mistake! We had breeders and owners of border collies look at her and had a good laugh saying she is a Pit Bull!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Barger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my dog, who was supposedly a Labradoodle but no one including our Vet seemed to believe it. Very easy to use and got results back in a couple weeks. Health results came back first and she was clear of 171 out of 172 things tested for. She is a potential carrier of a condition called “Exercised Induced Collapse “ but could only be a problem if we planned on breeding her which we do not. As far as the breed goes she is 50% Poodle, 38.3% Labrador Retriever, and 11.7% American Pit Bull Terrier,(her Great Grandmother). Very pleased with results and can’t wait to show them to the naysayers. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: if you've got it, spend it!
customer_reviews.text: if you've got the cash to spare, do this! I took my tax refund and tested both my dogs and wish now that id been able to do it for all my other dogs. all my dogs are/were from the street. this is SO nice to know what theyre made of, not that id love any of them the less but its sooo COOL. and surprising. and maybe beneficial to dogs yet to be for health reasons. the company asks you to fill out your dogs characteristics: a profile. it all goes in a data bank and maybe someday .... who knows? they do send back breed ancestry and characteristics. all well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: nikki lorel

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Found out my dog was completely 50% different breed than I originally thought. Also, I liked the feature that shows her health and also found out a condition that she has been suffering from is genetic. Using the new information about her, I am able to make better health decisions with her veterinarian. I thought she was suffering from an injury, turns out she is predisposed to certain type of degenerative spinal condition which helps me figure out her best treatment.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. My dog has luxating patellas and was given a clean bill of health "for what they test." Which isnt much. Total BS.
customer_reviews.author: Earthstar

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate? All dogs are mixed with Chow??
customer_reviews.text: I was told by the pet store employee that Embark results say all dogs are mixed with Chow and sure enough the results said my Bull terrier/French bulldog had Chow in it. I am retesting with my vet that uses a different company. I don't trust any of the results after being told. If in fact the vet test which fortunately is included in the pet care plan I will update this review. Updating after receiving the results from the vets DNA test- there is not Chow in my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprising and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT upload a photo and I also "played dumb" on questions. I Did the test with a Mixed breed dog. They really nailed it. 60% German Shepherd, and then Boxer and Terrier with some minor distant other info. Exactly what we believed and knew. I was totally shocked as I gave no information prior, no pics, no info, just the sample to analyze. I was very skeptical before, so now I'm ordering more for my other dog's where I actually don't know the true history or breed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Moore

customer_reviews.title: and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As a scientist, the kit was complete, simple, and easy to use. Results were quick and the website is easy. What is neat is that they give you the ability to download your raw data and look at it (if you want via genomics tools) and they update your data and new science gets published. Finally, they offer up a way to give data to them to help move the field. It is not cheap, but the health and breed data was priceless - on our rescue we really wanted to know somethings and it has helped a lot. Frankly, given all the things dogs can carry, Happy customer. No connections to the company.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: My mutt is ....
customer_reviews.text: My mutt came back with various breeds, some realistic some hard to imagine. My vet made a comment - well I suppose the process is what "Fun?" It was quite disturbing to get a report back that he was "SuperMutt" So I knew he was a mutt (mix) so I am not sure it was worth the money to have an identification as a "Super" Mutt. So my mutt is ... drum roll.... "A Mutt"! hmmm. Thanks Embark
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fishburne

customer_reviews.title: Very Inaccurate Breed Analysis
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 26 pounds. The low deviation from the mean weight for a female collie is 40, for a female golden retriever is 55, for a female lab is 55, for a female pit-bull is 30, and for a female bulldog is 40. Taking the LOW deviation of all these breeds doesn't get near to what my dog is. Not to mention my dog looks nothing like any of these breeds even remotely. I honestly was expecting Australian Cattle dog or Australian Shepherd. I purposefully neglected to provide a picture of my dog to this company to remove bias from the results provided to me. This is what they came up with. Shamefully inaccurate breed guessing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne Fryer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive and comprehensive report
customer_reviews.text: The result is very impressive with details down to colored codes by breeds and raw data to download down to the letters As, Ts, Cs, Gs, if you happened to be a geneticist and want to analyze the result yourself. For the rest common people like the majority of us, the breed information, ancestry lineage and 172 genetic predisposed diseases screening report are worthwhile enough for the money spent. The test is done by the Ivy league Cornell University School of Veterinary. I don't think $169 is enough to cover the whole cost of the whole test. It's probably just use to supplement their research. The result also gives a vet report that you can take to your vet.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Genetics reliable, health analysis...meh?
customer_reviews.text: I trust the ancestory. However, I got this done on my 1.5yo pup and it said he had no risk factors for kidney disease, however, he was diagnosed with congenital renal dysplasia and only has about ~2years to live. So not as confident in the health claims. Being in medicine, I do appreciate how they cite all their genetic analysis with scientific literature. FWIW, I ordered another one for my new dog but won’t look into the health analysis as much.
customer_reviews.author: David Roy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The wait time for my results wasn’t too long but the results were hard to believe when your dog looks nothing like what they’re telling you his breed combination is. Feel a bit scammed and wish I could get my money back. Save your time and money don’t purchase or find a cheaper kit elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Kempton

customer_reviews.title: Thorough testing, awesome communication!
customer_reviews.text: This test is so thorough! My pup tested positive for a genetic mutation which makes her at risk of developing DCM. However I did not receive this information in a list of test results but instead got a personal email from one of Embark’s Geneticist providing a thorough explanation and letting me know that I can contact her with any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Breed info plus valuable health information, and association with Cornell University and its research.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on the strength of Embark's association with Cornell University and dog research. What others have said is true. The Embark team gives regular updates and offers to clarify and explain. My dog's results were a surprise in the sense that the recessive genes seem to have come to the fore with him. I really appreciate the testing for 160 genetically related diseases as well as the extent of in-breeding. My dog looks very much like a rare breed that Embark's tests do not include, so I may have to get the competition's product, which tests for that breed, as well.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost!
customer_reviews.text: This DNA test was easy to use. The results came back relatively quickly, with informative notices along the way. I've used the Wisdom test as well. I think it's good to have taken both tests, to compare, but this test had far more results for my dog than the other, as well as more sensible breed mix. So I think it may be more accurate. I also really liked the health and the aging data. I adopted my dog 3 years ago from a shelter and was unsure how old she was, and now looking at this test, I have a better idea. It's also fun to share with family and friends!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: They are just guessing!
customer_reviews.text: This DNA test isn't exact. They group results and guess as to which breed the dog probably belongs. Not worth the investment. My vet said that "they are trying, but not there yet." So correct, doc!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Richards

customer_reviews.title: Embark vs Wisdom Panel. Both are good but Embark is much more detailed
customer_reviews.text: My dog's DNA was tested twice by Embark and Wisdom Panel (yes I wasted lots of money) and the results came out very similar! I'd say Embark is more accurate and detailed, but it's also twice the cost. :D Wisdom Panel: - Chihuahua 50% - Pomeranian 12.5% - Shih Tzu 12.5% - Undefined breeds 25% Embark: - Chihuahua 36.8% - Pomeranian 15.2% - Shih Tzu 22.5% - Miniature Pinscher 7.9% - Cocker Spaniel 5.2% - Others 12.4% The difference is minimal in my opinion so your call. By the way my dog is very cute!.
customer_reviews.author: Noble the Beast

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and incredibly in-depth report
customer_reviews.text: Firstly it's a bit pricey, but completely worth it. It is simple to register and get the sample from the dog and send off. Updates regularly throughout the process. Was truly blown away by the comprehensiveness of the report. They got so much spot on about my very mixed breed mutt :) I did pay the extra for medical predisposition portion. Even 4 weeks after getting the results, I am still going back and re-reading......fascinating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long Test Time, Accurate but not worth the value
customer_reviews.text: Results are just as accurate as several other options out there, but it took exceptional long, almost 2 months in my case. Health markers info are quite generic. At this price point you’re paying a premium price for less than premium testing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We did a LOT of research before choosing Embark and they did not disappoint. The amount of information that they share with you is really incredible. And it is both easy to navigate and understand. Our dog is a rescue from another state and without knowing, another family who adopted one of his brothers ALSO chose to use Embark. When we got the results, they informed us that one of our dog's siblings lived close by -- which we already knew -- which is part of what made it so cool! And verified for us that this is an accurate test. The health information they screen for is also such good information to have. Fully endorse.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doubt its accuracy
customer_reviews.text: i'm not a geneticist but I do not believe the breeds listed for my dog. Nothing looks like her.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Casper

customer_reviews.title: proved what i figured
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy pet insurance on a 3 year old dog that I was told is Bullmastiff...because bullmastiff are prone to a list of predisposed congenital problems, the insurance was 2x that of a mixed breed of the same size...he doesn't look or act like a bullmastiff so I paid for the test...test showed none of the DNA markers that a full blood would normally have...the test also showed that my pooch's GMa was 1/2 Saint Bernard and Boxer...apparently this is why he isn't suffering from the normal health issues for this breed...the money I'm saving on the dog insurance premiums will pay for the test in 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: vchateau

customer_reviews.title: Yeah DNA
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great experience with Embark. You get lots of info some will surprise you and some you won't totally understand. Took less time then quoted. Found out what mix our new addition is. Embark does lots of charity work and they work to improve canine health in shelters and with responsible breeders.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip B

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch. Ordered breed/health and was sent breed only test
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Embark test that includes both Breed and Health information. I received the breed only test. I paid for the more expensive test and was scammed and given the cheaper less helpful version.
customer_reviews.author: busymom

customer_reviews.title: useless...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, fine. I fell for it. Our dog is a Basset Hound / Pyrennes mix. He's got the signature howl, the stubby legs, the droopy eyes, and thick head and a long white coat with a patch of lightish brown here and there. His littermates either looked just like him or were all black. There is zero doubt about how they came to be. We just got the DNA results and it's says he's a pitbull/boxer/staffordshire/supermutt. lol they can gtfo with this junk
customer_reviews.author: Cornjob

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Really great DNA test for your pup! They keep adding new information to the results even after you get your initial results. Plus, you get breed and health diagnostics all in one test! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Fred J. K.

customer_reviews.title: We don't care because we love him, but that just made us curious to ...
customer_reviews.text: We got Bruno from craigslist. He was definitely not the full bread we were told he is. We don't care because we love him, but that just made us curious to know what he is. I research DNA tests and chose embark. I gave them our dogs name and the swab. Nothing else. NO photo, no description. His results seem to fit his size and markings perfectly. We were told he was chihuahua, but he looked like a large fox. Results came back 50%pomeranian, 23.8% chihuahua, 11.8% Shih Tzu, and 14.4% super mutt ( a long hard to determine mix of breeds in the ancestry) I also got a full health screening and tons of research! I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: My dog has WHAT in it?
customer_reviews.text: We were curious about the breed(s) of our three dogs, and considered three different DNA tests. Embark, while the most expensive, seemed to be the most comprehensive. Indeed, we found that our thirty pound bundle of energy has Rottweiler, Chow, Boxer, Shar Pei, Minni Schnauzer and Boston Terrier. Who knew? Sure the Shar Pei and Boston showed, but Rottie? The tests included DNA results for possible genetic illness tendencies, and it was reassuring to see those results. Overall, we were quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bogarts Boss

customer_reviews.title: Easy Easy Easy!!! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I admit I didn't really know what to expect. My rescue dog is a real mutt, but she makes this wierd sound. We tracked it down to an Australian Dingo. The rest kit showed up promptly, was very very easy to you. They kept me informed. I knew they received the samples, when they started testing and when 4he results were ready. The results were easy to read. My baby may not have Australian Dingo, but does have Australian Cattle Dog! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make the same mistake I did.... just use this one first.
customer_reviews.text: So much more accurate than wisdom panel. I made the mistake of trying the other first... same results as 7 other dogs that look nothing like mine. A friend got this one and her details were amazing!! Plus you get so many more perks with embark. 10/10. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CasiG

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This test is a complete scam - do not purchase! We should've believed all the other negative reviews. We adopted a small maltipoo from a family nearby so we've met the pup's parents. Our allergies started acting up a bit so we decided to purchase a test to see if she's mixed with anything else that may cause this (turns out it was just seasonal allergies). We had to wait 8 months to get the results back and it was so inaccurate. It claims that she is 25% pug and 11% pinscher, which is clearly wrong. Maltese wasn't even listed anywhere on the list. Save yourself the money and buy your pups some yummy treats instead!!
customer_reviews.author: red0116

customer_reviews.title: A ton of information / Incredible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend Embark. You are provided so much information in a professional manner. The ability to communicate results to your Vet is great. Embark communicates with you every step of the process. 1. When they get your sample, 2. Every couple of days to let you know they are working on it and what step they are at. At the same time they share interesting information and facts with you. 3. Each time they have one of the MANY results they provide you. This kind of service is so very rare these days. I cannot recommend them enough. Worth every single penny. I tell everyone I see that has a dog that they have to get Embark.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: What a scam- do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I'm not just one of those types who is disappointed not to hear their dog is as fancy as they supposed. There is no way my fluffy little corgi mix is 32.7% American Pit Bull Terrier. There's not one herding dog in the list of breeds they assumed. And 20.1% supermutt is just disappointing. What a scam.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer murray

customer_reviews.title: Accurate results.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate results and didn’t take too long. At first we thought results were wrong, until we asked for her mother to be tested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! There are so many cool features! Even after the test has completed and they make some new upgrades to their system they will try to make sure you get those new benefits. They had found a second health probelm after my test was finished and let me know! They keep you updated and well informed. And i really love that you can see other dog's profiles who have similar DNA and they can match up reletives as well! I highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine G.

customer_reviews.title: $100 dollars and no results? Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: After spending $100 and waiting 6 months for a result/response, I’ve had to resort to this review as a way to get a refund. Would not recommend if you want dependable results or communication. Go through your vet. I learned the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy. Thought my dog was a border collie and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy. Thought my dog was a border collie and lab mix but he looked way too tall. Well he's a Great Pyrenees and Black Lab mix 50/50! It's expensive but I trust the lab and they seemed to do quality work.
customer_reviews.author: DCRaider

customer_reviews.title: Answers a lot of questions on your strays
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a cool purchase if youre curious about your dogs breed. Our girl was literally saved in the middle of traffic with no tags or microchip. We took her in for the kind woman who saved her so she woukd not end up in a shelter. She was posted and reported everywhere but this sweet girls family never came forward so we kept her. She rapidly grew in our care, we thought she might of been a pitbull great dane mix as she was such a big girl. Ordered this DNA kit and were so pleasantly pleased to learn her breeds and answer some questions. 50% Dogo Argentino, 27% Presa canario, 16% Cane corso, 3.4% Rottweiler, 3.4% Neapolitan mastiff
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kit
customer_reviews.text: Results came back within a few weeks. Register on their site and they email you with updates. The package comes with a prepaid shipping label and envelope for the test tube. Was pretty easy to administer with my bid dog (good listener!) make sure they haven’t eaten anything soon before administering sample. Got the results and the site provides genetic health info, breed and cousins/close family found. Seems pretty accurate.... though, the result couldn’t pin my pup’s mom’s breed - and she was the one we knew! Maybe the results will be updated. Overall, a nice kit.
customer_reviews.author: Glam Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Quick and informative
customer_reviews.text: This test was amazing. I mainly got it to see health issues, which did show my dog was at risk for something but you can contact and call their vet to answer any questions. This kit tells you where his ancestors originated from, health risks, breed, possible family tree, and other dogs who share DNA with him. It also only took 3 weeks from ordering on amazon to getting results. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lolacrayola

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is legit. The DNA results came back with tons of info. We got a pekingese puppy 5 years ago and were told she was purebred but when she got older we knew she was mixed with something. The DNA showed she's 52% Shihtzu. We were pretty surprised. She looks mostly pekingese but has a shorter coat and longer nose so we always assumed she was part chihuahua. She has several relatives with 20% dna matches on the site which is pretty cool to see. I liked the health aspect of the test and plan on getting this for our other purebred pekingese for health portion.
customer_reviews.author: jim guenza

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Embark Dog DNA Test after being somewhat unsatisfied with another company's test results (one third of my dog's DNA was too mixed for the other company's test to determine specific breed information). Embark's more accurate test filled in the missing details and I am thrilled with the results. I highly recommend this product if you are interested in learning more about your dog's ancestry and health information.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Great DNA test results!
customer_reviews.text: This test is amazing! We used Wisdom Panel 2.0 on our other dog a few years ago and we didn't get a whole lot of data from them. This one, Embark, gives SO MUCH DATA! The best part is that everything they show makes sense, and I believe all of it. They were able to guess her coat color, her age, her health, and even her temperament... All from a freaking cheek swab that took me two minutes to do. I can't stop looking at her data. My dog is a spreadsheet now!
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: 100% Accurate and Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever. I wasn’t 100% certain I even believed that this test would be accurate. Was very skeptical from the beginning. This test prove me wrong over and over again. Wasn’t sure what kind of breed our dog was mixed with. This confirmed our thoughts and gave us a better explanation to understanding our dogs personality. This test was 100% accurate and I’m truly amazed! I would purchase this again for sure! Keep doing what you’re doing. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: We have a rescue GSD with an unknown lineage. We always thought she was mixed with something because she has some features not typical of a GSD. Although I didn't care what her breed was because she is a perfect rescue pup, my curiosity got to me and I ordered the Embark DNA kit. Well, much to our surprise, she is a purebred GSD! I also love that I now have an idea of what genetic health disorders to watch out for...if she exhibits symptoms I will know to act early to get her the care she needs to remain as healthy & happy as possible. Another fun feature is her list of likely relatives! So cool!
customer_reviews.author: LBW

customer_reviews.title: Embark can prolong your dog's life
customer_reviews.text: Embark showed that my dog might have liver disease now or in the future so we bought him to our vet for blood test. Embark can prolong your dogs life by giving you medical information that you might not have known about your dog until it's too late. Also it shows what we all were concerned about and his breeder is badly inbreeding and that is why my dog has some medical issues that we are taking care of for years. Embark gives you so much information about your dog besides disease and makes it very interesting and fun when you get the results.
customer_reviews.author: Lu John

customer_reviews.title: It’s just meh!
customer_reviews.text: Results were not as good as expected. They sell it like you’re going to learn all these great things and connect with relative dogs. The test is only as good as the current database of genetic info, so if you’re dog is any kind ignored mix, maybe wait a few years until they have more data...lest you receive a result back of blank percent “supermutt” which they can’t define any further. They just don’t have a large enough database of genetic info currently to make this worth your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Nifdy Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this is very accurate
customer_reviews.text: We have a dog we thought was a terrier chihuahua mix. He weighs 4.5 lbs. The results came back with no chihuahua at all, and instead we got poodle/dachshund. People will look at me like an idiot if I tell them that. I was also a little disappointed there wasn't any fun analysis on behavioral traits. Although the results didn't seem results, the company sent lots of updates via email about the status.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Superior to Wisdom Panel!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Wisdom Panel test from Amazon. It came, we did it right away. After much waiting, they contacted us that we did not have a good enough sample. They sent another test. We again followed directions and sent it in right away. Again waiting and bad sample. They did refund us our money after many follow-ups and a long waiting period and we were out the shipping. We ordered an Embark kit from their website (cheaper than Amazon) and it came, we completed it (easier than Wisdom panel, only one swab) and got the results before we had our refund from Wisdom Panel. Very satisfied with the product. Love the website.
customer_reviews.author: wendylack

customer_reviews.title: The Best Choice in DNA Testing for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a dog from South Korea and she has the most interesting appearance, but we did not know what type of mixed breed/s she was. We were told a poodle/terrier, but she certainly did not look at all like a poodle. Embark was a perfect answer for our questions. The entire process was professional and comprehensive. I highly recommend Embark to learn a lot about your pup's ancestry as well as any medical issues that could arise.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for detailed results and to contribute to ongoing scientific research.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is more expensive than others, and the results take a while, but the report is very comprehensive for genetic disease markers and reasonable for breed (unlike some tests where you get non-answers - if we wanted to know that our dog was a mixed breed, we wouldn't have paid for DNA testing). Off on predicted weight, but did indicate that he would be big for the breed. On a personal note, I just lost two dogs to cancer, so I like contributing to Cornell's dog DNA database and the research that might come from it.
customer_reviews.author: otisandtess

customer_reviews.title: Accurate results
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is from a shelter, though some info was known about the mother. The results on ancestry confirmed what we were told about the mother, so I think the results are accurate. We wanted the medical analysis to be aware of any potential problems. So I think both medical and ancestry results are important. Results were back quickly, and they email to keep you informed of the progress. So I thought this product was useful and well done. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow process - great product!
customer_reviews.text: The process was really easy to follow, and I got the results back way sooner than expected! I really like that they keep you posted on where they are at in the process with the DNA. Although the results were difficult to understand - I was able to reach out to Embark and get a response very quickly! The response thoroughly explained my dogs results and addressed my concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: We rescued a puppy and were told she was a chihuahua mix. I was curious as to what the mix was so I bought this. I am a little bummed by the results. 24% super mutt... I guess I didn’t find out anything that I didn’t already know and for the price I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brown86

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Embark DNA kit to find out everything I could on my newly rescued pit bull mix. The result showed her complete back history of breeds as well as any possible health concerns that might show up. This is a very complete test and they do a very good job of keeping in touch with you during the time between when you send it back to them and you getting it back.
customer_reviews.author: B. Russell

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to the accuracy of the test, as my mutt came from a rescue and not generations of papered showdogs. The test did say she was mostly a min-pin/chihuahua mix, and she certainly looks like one, so... pretty accurate? It was worth the cost for me to find out more about my furbaby, but still expensive. I knocked it down a notch for ease of use because, c’mon... have you ever tried to stick something in a dog’s mouth, and keep it there for 30 seconds? Ha! Would rather have drawn blood with a syringe and sent them that.
customer_reviews.author: TuxedoCartman

customer_reviews.title: This works great and awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to find out what breed our adopted "black lab" was. We were concerned that he was part great dane and lab but cone to find out he is mostly black lab, American bulldog and boxer. We also were happy to see that he has no genetic traits that could be harmful and costly in the future. It was a relief to know I wasnt going to have a 100 lb dog and that he was goinv to be healthy during his life which saves me money not worrying about pet insurance in case he had something genetic that would hurt him later on in life.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is a big scam. It says my dog (see photo) is over 50% Lhasa Apso plus 23% Supermutt. Totally useless. Oh yes, they did tell me my dog has short legs and needs to watch his weight. Really? I never would have guessed. The only reason I give it two stars is that it's very easy to use, and once you send the swab back, they're very responsive. But spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LucyAnn P

customer_reviews.title: Results were not close
customer_reviews.text: I know the mother and daddy of this pup and Embark was way off base on the primary breed percentage, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely interesting and pertinent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Quick results that are very detailed but easy to understand. Customer service is second to none. THEY CHECK 182 GENETIC HEALTH VARIANTS! I loved that because my dog is 10. It explained several behaviors that have baffled me since we got him at 7 months. His appearance is nothing like the breeds in his make-up. I highly recommend Embark.
customer_reviews.author: NellieLemon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Highly recomend!
customer_reviews.text: Great product & website. Got my result for my pup & it has been great to help with managing her health @ 14 yrs old. The level of detail was great & better than what I compared for other tests. Like that everything was inclusive. The results did take a while which is why I rated 4 & not 5 stars, but they were very informative about the steps & process. Once received, different genome steps & DNA analysis. This was nice to keep me informed about why it was taking a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Aradan

customer_reviews.title: Great test for my mystery dog
customer_reviews.text: Great response from customer service. I was really sceptical that Embark wouldn't be able to figure out what my new dog is. He's a rescue from China but I was told they covered East Asian Village dog DNA. The results came back faster than anticipated and boy was I surprised. HEs part Pekingese along with Village dog! It makes sense now. I recommend this test for any confused dog lover.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn L.

customer_reviews.title: So glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.text: We were very curious to know what are dog was (we adopted her from a shelter and did not know her breeds). I decided to order this DNA test because the reviews were good and the price difference was quite stark between the next leading option, leading me to believe the product either did not provide as much info as this one, or did not work as well. I am glad we made the investment as this test told us her family tree info, scanned her for health risks, found dogs with matching DNA that are related to her, and more. People always find the results so interesting and I recommend this test to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Kai Waning

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, very responsive customer service. Embark offers an amazing, in-depth DNA report that is clearly explained along with a visual family tree. The genetic health conditions that Embark tests for gave us such peace of mind that our rescue dog from Mexico wasn't at risk or a carrier. It was fascinating to learn about her breed type...We knew she was part poodle but had no idea that she was also 1/3 American Village dog - which is explained in detail in the report. Embark has done extensive research on Am. Village Dogs. Very cool! Even though it takes a little longer to get results I would definitely use Embark for any future dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Never would have guessed.
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a hound mix from the shelter in Parma Ohio. He came from a shelter In Tennesse, that all we knew. Just for fun, curiosity and to see his genetic markers on health we did this DNA test. We found out he’s going to be healthy and we are proud owners of a purebred Mountain Cur. I never knew this breed existed! So Cool! Thanks Embark!
customer_reviews.author: Ricks4400

customer_reviews.title: Activation code
customer_reviews.text: Update:: it tool about 4 days but they fixed the problem and I was able to activate my kit. I hope to get results in about 4 weeks. I just sent an email to the company and hopefully they can help, but I've been trying to activate my kit and it keeps saying that my code is not found and I even tried to put in the number on the swab bottle itself as we can do that too and nothing! I'm hoping they get back to me soon and fix this because I didn't waste so much money for this not to work!
customer_reviews.author: Alondra

customer_reviews.title: helped reveal hereditary issue
customer_reviews.text: Amazon deal of the day got me to purchase. Reputable company connected to Cornell U. Report revealed that my german shepherd is likely to have degenerative myelopathy or DM. I was hoping that wasn't the case but also wanted to know so I can do what I can should it become a reality. Our previous pet had this horrible genetic disease. Very comprehensive report. A good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: musicman

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to see what my dogs father was I knew the mother was a Maltese but my vet said her father could be a miniature schnauzer because she has the sliver , green eyes and the back line. I thought that what i would get. The test show She has NO MALTESE . In fact the test came back 60% CHIHUAHUA, 18.7 SHIH TZU, 12.3 POODLE, 9% POMERANIAN. WHAT A JOKE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it's in a beta test but provides some awesome information
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy I bought this but this is definitely not perfect. Starting with the bad. The family tree was not accurate. It was the same tree for both sides of the family. Then I got mixed for her parents but the grandparents and great grandparents were able to be determined? They give you each gene makeup but no description for each gene. The good it's so awesome to see the percentage of what type of dog your little special pup is. If that's what you're after go for this. Everything else seems like it's in beta.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: No gimmicks. They’re not guessing from a photo!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! I think they nailed it. I wish I could figure out how to post photos so you could judge for yourself. They ID’d my senior rescue dog as Brittany spaniel, Shiba inu, American Eskimo dog, and Australian cattle dog. Which makes perfect sense if you could see her! Plus, we got results for various medical conditions she might be prone to, which would be helpful info if you had a younger dog. I was skeptical about these dog DNA kits but am glad I spent the extra $ for this one. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D. Doblick

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the embark DNA test is well-designed, from the packaging to the communications to the website. The swabbing kit arrived promptly, and the embark people were good about sending progress report emails regularly, given that the results aren't available for several weeks. The results were presented in a very helpful format. I ordered the test because I was curious about the ancestry of my adopted mixed-breed. Of course, she is no different now that I know she's not part-German Shepherd than she was before, but at least I know why she has such a huge head!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: I originally did a test through Find My Pet DNA ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally did a test through Find My Pet DNA. Don't ever buy them. They are a scam. They looked at the picture and guessed, saying my dog was 35-75% chihuahua and 35-75% min pin--two dogs that weigh 10lbs or less each. My dog weighs 25. This test came back accurate, with none of those other two in him. Pay the extra $ and get this test. Also, this test gives a disease and health screen, which is invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Waibel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy to catch the Embark Dog DNA test kit on sale! When we got it, we spilled the liquid. :-( I called Embark, and they replaced the liquid for free. Excellent customer service! Plus, we got just what we wanted, and more. We found out the heritage of our rescue dog, and that he had no health issues and was not a carrier of any health issues, which set our minds at ease. We were impressed by the information they sent us, and they kept us in the "loop" at all times while they were running tests on the saliva. Easy to use and excellent results!
customer_reviews.author: SouthernGirl

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate description.
customer_reviews.text: I gave them no physical description of my dog, and they were still able to describe him quite accurately. The bloodline DNA, I have no way to know it's accuracy, but it is quite believable, but surprising. Not what I was expecting, but still able to see most contributor attributes. Except the German Shepherd and the Chow Chow. Really don't see any of that, but the percentages are small, so it's still believable. On the expensive side, but worth it, especially for the health screening part. Glad I chose Embark. Would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: RamLock

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: We rescued a dog from American Samoa. We are constantly asked what breed he is. We just say "village dog" because we didn't really know, and the dog population on the island is unique. We got the results back and are so happy because his official breed is "American Village Dog". It was very informative and we are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great DNA health/breed results
customer_reviews.text: The first box I had and ordered without any sale came with a cool tag and the second box I ordered for cyber Monday did not - even though it was the same breed kit. Besides that - I loved the health results! it gave me some peace of mind so I don’t have to worry about many health problems for my puppy, I adopted him and they said he was part Eskimo part Australian Shepherd and the test came out to be exactly that!!! I love the quick DNA results from embark (approx 3 weeks) and his relatives list :) my dogs Instagram is Darling.Poe if anyone would like to see him !
customer_reviews.author: lianna

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased to have the results I have in less than ...
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the money. I put the swab in the mail on February 17, and as of March 12 I've already got the health results back! No breed results yet, but having been told that I would have to wait 2 months for any results, I'm pleased to have the results I have in less than 1 month! I get periodic status updates all along the way. What a gift it is to have a health report to share with my vet, and to know that my dog is clear of all tested congenital problems! I can't wait to find out what kind of mix she is...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make No Mistake..
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with Embark! The people who gave us our dog, Mistake, said his dad was a German Shepherd and his mom was a boxer/pit mix. We have speculated another breed possibility due to his size- he is 100 pounds and very tall. People have suggested Anatolian Shepherd and we just wanted to finally know for sure. Turns out he is just that- German Shepherd/Boxer/Staffordshire Terrier mix! Very happy with the fast results and all the added features- finding his close relatives and checking for genetic diseases. The weight estimate was not accurate- they estimated around 84 lbs- which is probably estimated from the breed standards and not his DNA, but everything else exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Vella

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: So, we just got DNA results back for our 16 month old boy. It took longer than expected, but that's not a big deal to me. It was great to see his health results. We were given one specific piece of information to pass along to our vet. The mix of breeds that came back was quite surprising. We thought we had a terrier mix based on the foster family he came from, but that wasn't the case. I guess that's why we did this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased to be able to print a report for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Embark keeps you excited about the process with texts and emails over the testing. I learned about my dog's breed and also that he had a couple of genetic health issues. I was pleased to be able to print a report for my vet. We will have things to watch and also monitor in his blood work. I was very happy and pleased with the reports. I think it was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Feels True
customer_reviews.text: I gave as little information as possible about my dog when creating the profile. The results that came back, while they had a surprise, it was a believable one. The genetic predisposition to disease was also useful. I have something to discuss with Jase's vet now so we can be looking for any early signs of what he came back as being at greater risk for. The test results correctly identified all his physical traits. I feel this test was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

product_meta.title: Embark | Dog DNA Test | Breed & Health Kit | Breed Identification & Canine Genetic Health Screening
feature_bullets: BREED IDENTIFICATION: Embark screens for over 350 dog breeds, types, and varieties. Using a research-grade genotyping platform developed in partnership with Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine, Embark offers the most accurate breed breakdown on the market.

HEALTH SCREENING: Embark tests for 190+ genetic diseases including MDR1 drug sensitivity, glaucoma, degenerative myelopathy, and dilated cardiomyopathy, some of the most common adult-onset diseases in dogs. Keep your dog healthier & happier, longer.
HIGHEST RATED: Embark's Breed + Health DNA test is the highest rated dog DNA test on Amazon.com.

DISCOVER YOUR DOG’S RELATIVES: Find and connect with other dogs that share DNA with yours, including distant and close relatives. Only Embark will give you a percentage of shared DNA between your dog and others that have been tested with Embark.
FAST, TRUSTED RESULTS: Built by experts, only Embark is partnered with Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine and is trusted by veterinary hospitals. Results generally between 3-5 weeks.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
